security_audit.summary: All 86 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is a pure documentation-based skill containing only markdown, JSON configuration, and skill manifests. No executable code, cryptographic operations, network access, or command execution exists. The static scanner incorrectly flagged common words like 'conventional', 'concise', 'descriptive' as weak cryptographic algorithms, and misinterpreted markdown backtick formatting as shell execution. This is a benign documentation-only skill for drafting commit messages.

content.user_title: Draft clear commit messages from staged changes
content.value_statement: Writing clear commit messages is challenging. This skill analyzes your staged git changes and creates descriptive commit messages that explain what changed and why it matters.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes staged git changes with git diff --cached
Generates commit messages in supportive or concise style
Supports descriptive and conventional commit formats
Reads local config.json for customizable behavior
Provides context about why changes matter
Shows file and line change statistics

use_cases.title: Write clearer commit history
use_cases.description: Create meaningful commit messages that help future you understand what was done and why

use_cases.title: Maintain consistent messaging
use_cases.description: Follow team conventions with conventional commits format support for better changelog generation

use_cases.title: Improve contribution quality
use_cases.description: Draft professional commit messages that meet project contribution guidelines

faq.question: What tools does this work with?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works in any git repository.

faq.question: How long can commit messages be?
faq.answer: Configure concise or detailed length in config.json based on your team preferences.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my workflow?
faq.answer: Stage changes with git add, run the skill, copy the message, then commit manually.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill runs locally, reads only staged changes, and sends nothing externally.

faq.question: What if the message is wrong?
faq.answer: The skill generates a draft for you to review and edit before using in your commit.

faq.question: How is this different from AI commit tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on clarity and context, not just summarizing changes. You stay in control.
